Upside_Review: Very polite employee named Serdar, professionally answered all questions about the hotel and the city
Downside_Review:
The room is very old, yellow towels, torn linens, no half of the buttons on the TV remote. There was someone's clothes in the closet and it was very dusty (questions to the cleaning service). Checked out of the room at 5 am, warned the receptionist about it - she offered to arrange my lunchbox. I was glad of the attention of the staff as I had a long trip after leaving the hotel and I really needed breakfast (and besides, I had it prepaid). When I checked out at 5am another receptionist just threw up his hands and said that no lunchbox was ordered for me. I rarely write bad reviews as I myself have long worked in hotels and understand the complexities of this business. But this time I would like to point out the level of service at the hotel. This is not even three stars, terribly disappointed with the accommodation.

Terrible numbers. We asked to change bed linen three times, and all three times they brought sheets with holes and stains from blood and urine. Location in the center, BUT at the bazaar, the windows face the road, round-the-clock signals of motorcyclists, a lot of merchants, right on the corner of the hotel there is an open toilet for visitors to the bazaar. Terrible stench outside and inside. The air conditioner doesn't work. There is no hot water. There are stains and mold everywhere. The toilet is completely covered in black mold. We booked a hotel for 10 days, but after 2 nights we ran away. We were shown 5 more alternative rooms, and in all the situation was the same. Nothing to do with the photos on booking.com. Taxi drivers do not drive up to the hotel, and even to check out, I had to walk to the nearest adequate road with my suitcases 500 meters.

Upside_Review:

It was my second visit in this hotel. Nice hotel. Big room, great breakfast, good location.
